style.questionRef: Use '(Q. XX)' across all languages. In Spanish, you may use '(P. XX)' if already used consistently.
style.years: Keep numeric years as in English (e.g., 1776).
style.properNouns: Preserve official English names alongside localized forms where standard (e.g., 'George Washington' / 'Jorge Washington' — prefer original for people).
style.quotes: Use double quotes for titles, keep punctuation consistent per language norms.
style.rtl: For Arabic, verify RTL rendering, punctuation direction, and numerals style as per app defaults.

terms.note: Capitalize per language rules when used as document title.
Anthem title typically kept in English; optional localized gloss can be added in parentheses.
For French/Chinese, prefer historically standard localized names.
Use respectful and widely-accepted contemporary term.
